title.narrative: 04.03 ACCESS TO Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH)

description.narrative: By the end of 2015, an additional 1.5 million population uses drinking water and sanitation services, and improves hygiene practices such as washing hands with soap and water treatment at home in communities, schools and health facilities in disadvantaged areas, which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, the prevalence of diarrhea is reduced by 15% and the incidence of helminth infections reduced by 10% and at least 30% of parents, guardians, heads of families and children wash their hands with soap and water at crucial moments, consume drinking safe water and know how to treat water at their home before consumption and use hygienic

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2015, an additional 1.5 million population uses drinking water and sanitation services, and improves hygienepractices such as washing hands with soap and water treatment at home in communities, schools and health facilities indisadvantaged areas

description.narrative: In 2017 UNICEF contributed to increasing equitable access to quality WASH interventions by vulnerable populations, with a special focus on facilitating access to safe drinking water to 106,709 new persons; and increasing WASH services availability and accessibility in 87 schools and 14 health facilities in deprived areas. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/12/2017
